page.title: 13HARP HILL
page.content: {HARP HILL}RISES SHARPLY FROM THE EDGE OF TOWN TO BECOME THE START OF THE {COTSWOLD HILLS.}AN EXPENSIVE PRIVATE ESTATE IS BUILT ON THE SLOPES ENJOYING EXTENSIVE VIEWS OF THE TOWN. AT THE FOOT OF THE HILL IS{BATTLEDOWN {HOSPITAL}WHICH CATERS FOR SICK CHILDREN. THE HOSPITAL ALSO HAS ITS OWN SCHOOL FOR CHILDREN WHO HAVE LONG TERM ILLNESSES OR HAVE CERTAIN EDUCATIONAL PROBLEMS. THE CHILDREN FROM HOLY TRINITY SCHOOL WHO VISITED THE HOSPITAL FELT THAT IT WAS "NICE AND COSY AND FRIENDLY". AT THE TOP OF THE HILL THE HOUSES END AND THERE IS A {SMALL RESERVOIR}WHICH IS A PART OF THE SYSTEM TO SERVE CHELTENHAM HOMES WITH WATER. AT THIS SPOT THERE ARE MANY WILD FLOWERS AND SOME COPPICED WOODS AND HAY FIELDS. FIELD BOUNDARIES ARE EITHER COTSWOLD STONE WALLS, BARBED WIRE OR ELECTRIC FENCES.
